title: Perma banned, No email, chat logs do not justifie the ban
body:

replies.body:
You're harassing Annie for mistakes, and threatening reports against other players. What exactly are these contributing toward a win? I realize you think you're giving advice to Annie at one point, and you do have a suggestion in there, though presented in a rather negative tone. It *is* possible to give constructive feedback without linking it to an insult.

But there's something to understand about your ban: It's not just this one game that, by itself, brought about this ban. Permabans are handed out when there's a consistent pattern of negative behavior across many games, and also generally after several warnings are given (by means of chat restrictions and temp-bans). You failed to heed those warnings. 

As for the email, have you checked your spam folders? Or do you have your inbox set to automatically delete anything it regards as spam? Since you didn't get the ban notification, or any emails about the creation of your ticket, it sounds like your email is filtering stuff out from riotgames. If you did submit a support ticket, you should be able to log back into the support site and view the status of your current and past tickets there, though.

You were permabanned because you were continually harassing players after multiple warnings about your behavior. *It wasn't just that one game*. Please, understand that. That game was the last nail in the coffin, but there were many other games involved leading up to your permanent ban.

And it doesn't matter that you hadn't played for a couple weeks. 2 weeks not playing the game doesn't magically clear your account of any past wrongdoings. You were probably harassing players before you took a break, and you still were when you came back from the break.

Oh but i understand that  ! 
What i dont get it, the perma ban right away after one game , and whiteout any analyze or the chat and context, beside the words i said to Annie ... i dont think this worths a ban.

But you don't seem to understand it. 
You're trying to look at it as "I was perma-banned for saying x to Annie in this game", but that's largely a false statement. At the very least, it's completely misleading. Again, your harassment towards that Annie was the last straw, after a very long pattern of the same behavior. That pattern shows that you aren't willing to correct your behavior at all, and that unwillingness is what had lead you to a permanent ban.

I've seen an analogy to the points system they use for traffic violations, and it's a rather fitting one for this situation. Certain violations may result in having your license revoked after just one or two instances. But somebody else might just be caught speeding enough times in a year, and wind up having their license revoked as well. Typically, speeding by itself doesn't result in losing your license. But do it enough, and it'll happen.

Not playing games doesn't lower your account status. You have to play games and show you reformed. So if this is your first game since your 14 day ban, the system sees you as coming back from your 14day ban and not showing any reform what so ever.

So here's the thing. Your log is definitely punishable. By itself, I'd say that it's not worth a perma-ban, but the context surrounding it is important in this case. Specifically, the punishment system was recently adjusted to once-again work on a scaling system. It looks a little like this:

* 10-game chat restriction
* 25-game chat restriction
* 14-day time ban
* Permanent ban

As I said, your log is punishable. Which means that the system issues the next punishment up the scale from your last one. In this case, your last punishment was a 2-week ban, so it issued a perma.
asking someone to report someone else is a bannable offence... so... you're banned...

I still find it difficult to believe that Riot is simply handing out permanent bans for only one incident.  There has to be a history of such things.  One time of saying "Oh, you suck" does not equal a ban.  I refuse to believe it works that way around here.

The aren't (except in the MOST extreme cases... eg death threats or the like). This is just another QQ thread from someone who has been toxic for a LONG time and finally reached the end of the road.

It doesn't matter if you don't think your behaviour is toxic because Riot clearly does and they are the final authority in this matter.

It doesn't matter if you were just responding to Annie's provocations either.  All that means is that your teammates had to deal with both you and Annie being toxic and ruining their game.

Players do not get banned for a single game unless they are extremely toxic in it.  This game was the final straw that resulted in your ban, but it was not the only game which factored into it.  Since you seem to be denying that your behavior in this chat log was toxic, then it's quite likely that this is your normal behaviour and the ban is more than justified.
